metadata.title: Acute Encephalopathy Associated with Infl uenza A Infection in Adults

abstract.original_text: We report acute encephalopathy associated with infl uenza A infection in 3 adults. We detected high cerebrospinal fl uid (CSF) and plasma concentrations of CXCL8/IL-8 and CCL2/MCP-1 (CSF/plasma ratios >3), and interleukin-6, CXCL10/IP-10, but no evidence of viral neuroinvasion. Patients recovered without sequelae. Hyperactivated cytokine response may play a role in pathogenesis.

sentences.segment_text: We report acute encephalopathy associated with infl uenza A infection in 3 adults .
We detected high cerebrospinal fl uid ( CSF ) and plasma concentrations of CXCL8/IL -8 and CCL2/MCP -1 ( CSF/plasma ratios > 3 ) ,
but no evidence of viral neuroinvasion .
Hyperactivated cytokine response may play a role in pathogenesis .
